content.description: Climb the corner from a stand start on a good edge. a lower start from down and right is also possible.
content.location: The far right corner of the large boulder in the hang out spot for the top rope area.

content.description:
This route climbs straight up an easy fun crack from the hangout spot for Toprope Wall and into a chimney with large chock-stone.

If you know the name of this route, please enter it in the comments section.
content.protection:
Standard rack

-Long slings/cord and small (<1") cams for anchor

-Easy anchor if you can sling the rock pinches, but it's a bit of a reach.
content.location: This is the chimney with large chockstone to the right of Horse Play.

content.description: The crack inside the chimney on the right side of the top rope wall. The chimney is off. The Crux is the start with tricky feet then it gets easy and fun, then top out on a flake and head into a slab boulder problem.
content.protection:
You can set up a TR with some cams and a big sling.

Or lead with a normal rack. If you lead it, its kind of PG 13 because after the crack there is a slabby part where you could deck onto a flake/ledge. You can put pro in part way up, so it isn't to bad.
content.location: On the ride side of the TR wall inside the chimeny.

content.description: This is an easier version of Ant Line. Layback up the right side (More fun if you don't use the slab to the right). Then a few face moves/chimney to a fun undercling traverse and then up the flake to the top.
content.protection: 2 bolts at the top for TR. Could be lead with a normal rack and some wide gear.
content.location: This is the right most route on the far left slab.

content.description: Go straight up the thin balancy slab.
content.protection: TR off the 2 bolts at the top.
content.location: This route is straight up the center of the slab on the far left side of the TR Wall.

content.description: Go up the slab until you can get to some jugs and then top out to a few more slabby moves.
content.protection: TR from 2 bolts at the top. To get to the top either rap off the tree used to set up Ant Line/Horse Play or do an easy down climb to the top.
content.location: Far left side of the TR Wall. The left most route on the slab

content.description: Start at a easy sloppy crack and top out onto a ledge (or walk up around the side), then reach up and jam an fist in or undercling a fang hold and continute up the crack with hands and fists. Then the crack gets thin and you have to do some finger jams and then follow it up and use the arete at the top.
content.protection: Easy TR off the sappy tree. Or lead with a normal rack.
content.location: In the center of the wall just to the right of Ant Line.

content.description: Super hard slabby route. I stick clipped up this like 10 years ago and flopped all over the place, but maybe if it’s up here someone else will give it a shot and can add more info.
content.location: This is down the hill from the top rope wall. Walk down about 1 minute through a little tunnel and it’s on your right. The old aid bolt ladder is to the left.

content.description:
Undercling the flake and then traverse left and layback up the flake and then top out. Really short route.

Be gentle this thing feels like its going to break.
content.protection: TR. Set up a TR at the top of Blackies/Black and Blue.
content.location: The right on the far right just before the cave. The big flake.

content.description: Nice sort of flaring handcrack with some awkward jams between the good ones, it's too bad it's so short. A lot of people probably just boulder it but it would be a good practice lead for new leaders. Felt a bit easier than Reed's direct.
content.protection: Standard rack. If bouldering, best to just not fall.
content.location: Right side of the top rope wall, there is a fallen tree directly to the right of the crack.

content.description: Take the easy (5.5) crack up and top out, then up the left side of the face. It looks nice and juggy but they are really small and rounded when you get up to them. The feet are a little chossy in sections, so smearing is hard.
content.protection: Sling a big horn at the top right. I also used two small cams in a crack and then dropped some webbing over the top to keep it over the middle of the wall.
content.location: The right face. This is the left route.

content.description: The arete on the right side of the TR wall.
content.protection: 2 new bolts at the top and you can sling a small horn.
content.location:
On the arete on the outside of the chimney/Reeds Direct.

You can set up an anchor for Reeds Direct and rap to the top of this or scramble up the side/back.

content.description:
The greatest line in the Angeles.

Up scoop to undercling, transition into this, tenuous moves right to the crux and into the dihedral with thin crack - up this to roof. Trickyness and long reach to left and under the roof, burly mantle leads to knobby face and fun cruising.
content.protection: Many thin to medium. Often TR'ed and rightly so.
content.location: The obvious line, undercling, shallow dihedral, roof, then knobby face.  Google Maps location 34°20'48.8"N 118°01'02.9"W or 34.346889, -118.017469
